Introduction

Ahn Hyejin, known under her stage name Hwasa, is a South Korean singer-songwriter, rapper, dancer, and television personality under P Nation. She is best known as the lead rapper, one of the lead vocalist, and maknae of the girl group MAMAMOO. and a former member of the project girl group Refund Sisters.

Hwasa lived with her parents and two elder sisters, and became friends with Wheein in middle school. Hwasa has wanted to become a singer since she was young, and was inspired by Beyoncé. She considered acting to be the second thing she loves, wanting to participate in musicals or acting. She joined RBW as a trainee in 2011 alongside Wheein. then she debuted under the stage name "Hwasa" as part of the group MAMAMOO on June 19, 2014.

On February, 2019, She made her solo debut with the digital single "TWIT".

Fun facts

1
Hwasa's Baptismal name is María.
…
2
Hwasa was named the Rookie Female of the Year in Variety in 2019 and won an MBC Ent. award for her work on “I Live Alone.”
…
3
Hwasa wrote and composed “I Do Me” on MAMAMOO's first mini-album, “Hello.”
…
4
Her name, "Hwasa" means "Shining Star" and is of Korean origin.
…
5
Prior to her debut, Hwasa was featured in Phantom's "Fingernail" and Park Shin Hye's "Break Up For You, Not Yet For Me" credited as HJ and Mario respectively in 2013.
…
6
Hwasa has 18 songs credited in JASRAC.
…
7
Hwasa, along with Moonbyul, made a cameo in a movie titled, Jazzy Misfits.
…
8
Hwasa had also composed the song “Freakin Shoes” from their album “Pink Funky.”
…
9
Hwasa appeared on “King of Masked Singer” as Aerobic girl.
…
